result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wade Charles Hovind

records.addlTxt: for Dunn County Case 21CF47. Counts 1 and 2 in St. Croix County Case 22CF155 dismissed and read-in to Dunn County Case 21CF47.  gll
Signed by ADA Becker. km       to rg
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

**AMENDED**

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.Frye except by text or email for the health, safety and welfare of children. Face to Face contact for Exchange of children Only no more then 5 minutes. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on March 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.Frye except by text or email for the health, safety and welfare of children. Exchange of children must be done with other party.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:52 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF: Wade Charles Hovind appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE to obtain private counsel.  Bond arguments. Atty Harrelson waives speedy prelim time limits. Court orders bond. Court sets STC.  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.
